LL4342V/LL5342V/LL6342V Taxation of Cross-Border Commercial Transactions
description:
This course will be useful for those who want to practise corporate or tax law.

Topics covered:
- the Singapore corporate tax, GST and stamp duty implications of (a) related party transactions; (b) restructurings and; (c) M&As
- structuring techniques to increase tax efficiency in each of these situations
- selected US corporate tax and Australian GST rules (since the tax consequences of a foreign country will have to be analysed)
- how structuring strategies may be challenged with rules/proposed rules addressing treaty shopping, debt-equity and entity classification hybridity, and arbitrage opportunities involving the GST treatment of cross-border transations.
title: Taxation of Cross-Border Commercial Transactions
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
